level.heading: Criminal action.
level.text: A person who willfully violates § 48-702(1) is guilty of a misdemeanor, and, upon conviction, shall be fined not more than $5,000 for the first offense or $10,000 for the second or subsequent offense, imprisoned for not more than one year, or both. Each day that a violation continues is a separate violation under this chapter. The fines set forth in this section shall not be limited by § 22-3571.01. The fines set forth in this section shall not be limited by § 22-3571.01.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 added the last sentence.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 113(g) of the Criminal Fine Proportionality Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-45, April 1, 2013, 60 DCR 5400, 20 DCSTAT 1300).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 8-137
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 8-137, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-701.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-317
level.text: Law 19-317, the "Criminal Fine Proportionality Amendment Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-214. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Oct. 16, 2012, and Nov. 1, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 23, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-641 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-317 became effective on June 11, 2013.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 19-317: Section 401 of D.C. Law 19-317 provided that the act shall apply only to offenses committed on or after June 11, 2013.
